00032 // Interface for Url type.
00033 //
00034 // jhrg 9/7/94
00035 
00036 #ifndef _url_h
00037 #define _url_h 1
00038 
00039 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00040 #ifdef __GNUG__
00041 #pragma interface
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #include <string>
00046 
00047 #ifndef _dods_limits_h
00048 #include "dods-limits.h"
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 #ifndef _basetype_h
00052 #include "BaseType.h"
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 #ifndef _str_h
00056 #include "Str.h"
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 const unsigned int max_url_len = 255;
00060 
00065 class Url: public Str {
00066 
00067 private:
00068     string _buf;
00069 
00070     // This enables methods of Str to access _buf in this class.
00071     friend class Str;
00072 
00073 public:
00074   Url(const string &n = "");
00075   virtual ~Url() {}
00076 
00077     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00078 };

00164  * Major modifications to the transmission and representation of values:
00165  * Added card() virtual function which is true for classes that
00166  * contain cardinal types (byte, int float, string).
00167  * Changed the representation of Str from the C rep to a C++
00168  * class represenation.
00169  * Chnaged read_val and store_val so that they take and return
00170  * types that are stored by the object (e.g., inthe case of Str
00171  * an URL, read_val returns a C++ String object).
00172  * Modified Array representations so that arrays of card()
00173  * objects are just that - no more storing strings, ... as
00174  * C would store them.
00175  * Arrays of non cardinal types are arrays of the DODS objects (e.g.,
00176  * an array of a structure is represented as an array of Structure
00177  * objects).
00178  *
00179  * Revision 1.8  1995/02/10  02:22:51  jimg
00180  * Added DBMALLOC includes and switch to code which uses malloc/free.
00181  * Private and protected symbols now start with `_'.
00182  * Added new accessors for name and type fields of BaseType; the old ones
00183  * will be removed in a future release.
00184  * Added the store_val() mfunc. It stores the given value in the object's
00185  * internal buffer.
00186  * Made both List and Str handle their values via pointers to memory.
00187  * Fixed read_val().
00188  * Made serialize/deserialize handle all malloc/free calls (even in those
00189  * cases where xdr initiates the allocation).
00190  * Fixed print_val().

00198  * mfuncs read and (now) read_val from the classes Byte, ... Grid. The
00199  * declaration in BaseType is sufficient along with the decl and definition
